question_paper.question_paper_name: IIT M FOUNDATION QUIZ2 EXAM QPB1 10 July 2022 IBA
question_paper.question_paper_description: 2022 July: IIT M FOUNDATION QUIZ2 EXAM

questions.question_text_1: Ram has to choose a t-shirt for his outfit from a collection of 6 yellow t-shirts, 2 black t-shirts and 4 blue t-shirts. If a t-shirt is chosen randomly, then what is the chance that a black or a blue t-shirt is chosen by Ram for his outfit ?
question_texts: Ram has to choose a t-shirt for his outfit from a collection of 6 yellow t-shirts, 2 black t-shirts and 4 blue t-shirts. If a t-shirt is chosen randomly, then what is the chance that a black or a blue t-shirt is chosen by Ram for his outfit ?

questions.question_text_1: A fair die is thrown twice independently. What is the probability of getting two numbers whose product is odd?
question_texts: A fair die is thrown twice independently. What is the probability of getting two numbers whose product is odd?

questions.question_text_1: In a hospital, 40% of the patients are male. It is known that 15% of male patients are suffering from cancer and 10% of female patients are suffering from cancer. If a patient is selected randomly, then based on the given information, answer the subquestions.
question_texts: In a hospital, 40% of the patients are male. It is known that 15% of male patients are suffering from cancer and 10% of female patients are suffering from cancer. If a patient is selected randomly, then based on the given information, answer the subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: What is the probability that the selected patient is suffering from cancer? (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal accuracy)
question_texts: What is the probability that the selected patient is suffering from cancer? (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal accuracy)

questions.question_text_1: If the selected patient is suffering from cancer, then what is the probability that the patient is a female? (Enter the answer correct to 2 decimal accuracy)

questions.question_text_1: A boy went to a bakery shop to purchase chocolates. If there are 5 dark chocolates and 3 milk chocolates, of which two are to be purchased by him, then in how many ways can it be done such that both of the purchased ones are either dark chocolate or the milk chocolate?
question_texts: A boy went to a bakery shop to purchase chocolates. If there are 5 dark chocolates and 3 milk chocolates, of which two are to be purchased by him, then in how many ways can it be done such that both of the purchased ones are either dark chocolate or the milk chocolate?
Answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: Select the steps from the following options, that you will use for the selection of chocolates to be purchased.  Note: This question is optional. We will check your answer to this question if you make a mistake in the previous one.

questions.question_text_1: How many numbers can be formed using the digits 0, 1, 3, 5, 7, 9 (without repetition), such that the number formed is greater than 20,000?

questions.question_text_1: In a school, there are 3 students in section-A, 4 students in section-B and 5 students in section-C. Find the number of ways, in which 8 students can be selected such that it include at least 2 students from each section and at most 5 students from the total 7 students in section-A and B.
question_texts: In a school, there are 3 students in section-A, 4 students in section-B and 5 students in section-C. Find the number of ways, in which 8 students can be selected such that it include at least 2 students from each section and at most 5 students from the total 7 students in section-A and B.
Answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: If an analyst wants to categorize the satisfaction level of a ride as “not happy, happy, very happy” which is serviced by a transport company, then which scale of measurement is suitable for the satisfaction level?

options.option_text: Number of road accidents in a month is a numeric and continuous variable.
Age of a student (in years) in a class is a numeric and continuous variable.
